body: I'll wait on doing this until Yinan's commit's get pushed.
LGTM. Make sure the new config is documented.
Had a small comment on the documentation changes, otherwise everything else looks good

For logging on the standalone mode, this page https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/wiki/Gobblin%20Deployment mentions it. I think we should remove this part in README that is covered on the Deployment wiki page and just have a link to that page instead.
LGTM.
LGTM.

OK, I reverted the package renaming commit and only leave here the changes to the scripts. I will have a separate pull request for package name renaming once we all agree on how the package names should look like.
I looked through parts of it, but it's really long. Everything I saw looks good though.

LGTM.

Here is the command for downstream projects which don't need package restructuring. It's best run on a clean copy.

grep -rlE 'com.linkedin.gobblin|com.linkedin.uif' \* | egrep -v '\.git|\.jar|\.class' | xargs sed -e 's/com.linkedin.gobblin/gobblin/g' -e 's/com.linkedin.uif/gobblin/g' -i ""
LGTM. There is some cleanup that should be done, but since this is a hot fix and is blocking all other deployments lets merge it ASAP, and we can do the cleanup after we are out of the woods.
I added a script for running the tool as part of gobblin-dist and tested it locally on my box.
We will not be merging this in as this is not for general use. Closing it.
Pull request updated.
LGTM.
LGTM. Thanks!
LGTM.

I was looking at different open source projects yesterday, and noticed that quite a few follow the structure where each submodule begins with "[project-name]-..." such as "samza-core" or "hadoop-core". I think the reason is that the submodule name determines the name of the artifact produced. Meaning given the current setup the project would produce jars such as "api-[version].jar", which may be a little too generic.

What does everything think about pre-pending "gobblin-" to each submodule name?
I like the idea of adding 'gobblin-' to each module name. One more example: https://github.com/apache/flink.
We should absolutely do that.
Updated
LGTM.
It's good to extract common configuration properties and put them into a common .properties file for each data source.
Merged
LGTM.
Merged

We have several sources in stand-alone mode. We can have common properties for each source. But not across all sources. If we want to add common properties across all sources, we may add only 1 or 2.
How to define common properties for each source? 
If we add common properties under common.properties then it will be applicable for all sources.
Can you change the name table_full_no_primarykey_or_no_delta_columns.pull to table_full_no_primary_keys_no_delta_columns?
Update the filename to table_full_no_primary_keys_no_delta_columns.pull. Can you please review it.
I don't see any quality checkers in the config. Is this intentional?

We are using the default quality checkers only. That is the reason why I haven't included them. It is not available in other sample config also (sftp-example.job). Let me know if you still want to me to add it.

Removed LumosAttributesConverter and added default quality checker and publisher to the config files.
Please review the same.

I removed the lumos related task policy but I forgot to remove it from policy types.
Now I removed the extract OPTIONAL from qualitychecker.task.policy.types.
Please review it.

The compaction tool (jar, src, lib, config files) are packaged in the tar ball. Or should I untar and put separate files in gobblin-compaction/ ?
I think you should treat it as a separate gradle module with src. You can put config file to conf/, and scripts to bin/. For jars, you can add dependencies in build.gradle.

Can you put in more details on why it doesn't work? BTW: the dependency should be added to the module that needs it, e.g., example, instead of distribution.

From: Yinan Li <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>>
Reply-To: linkedin/gobblin <reply@reply.github.com<mailto:reply@reply.github.com>>
Date: Tuesday, February 24, 2015 at 9:19 AM
To: linkedin/gobblin <gobblin@noreply.github.com<mailto:gobblin@noreply.github.com>>
Subject: Re: [gobblin] add log4jextra compile dependency (#27)

Can you put in more details on why it doesn't work? BTW: the dependency should be added to the module that needs it, e.g., example, instead of distribution.

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/27#issuecomment-75800609.

log4jextras is a runtime dependency, so I think the distribution module is the right place. However, I think it should be expressed as a runtime dependency rather than a compile time one (e.g. runtime log4jextras)

This dependency must get lost in one of the big checkins. Yinan, Sahil, you can trace down to where is the original build.gradle to specify it. Since its blocking several people for trying out Gobblin, I will check it in for now.

Lin

log4jextras is a runtime dependency, so I think the distribution module is the right place. However, I think it should be expressed as a runtime dependency rather than a compile time one (e.g. runtime log4jextras)

As Sahil said, it should be a runtime dependency. Can you use runtime before committing it?

We can address this issue in a different pull request, but right now it seems hard for a user to add a jar to the libjars parameter when launching the job. They would have to manually modify the gobblin-mr.sh file. Perhaps we can modify the script to make it easier.

Besides the few comments, everything looks good to me. Thanks a bunch for contributing your changes back, it is greatly appreciated! Hope you are finding Gobblin useful, and of course any feedback about the project is always welcome :)
1 small comment, otherwise LGTM
1 comment, rest LGTM
I checked the updateRecordMetrics, updateByteMetrics in TaskState. The task metrics would be updated there along with the job metrics. Do we need to make changes to these two methods as well?

We are still collecting task-level metrics so TaskState.updateRecordMetrics and TaskState.updateByteMetrics are still doing what they are supposed to do. We are just not reporting task-level metrics as Hadoop counters if turned off.
LGTM. Thanks!
@ydailinkedin, please test this in your purger job and let me know how it goes.
Sure. Actually I am testing it now.
Comment addressed.

Just one comment: since gobblin-mapreduce.sh takes the namenode URL (-fs) as one of the input argument, it would be better to use that to populate fs.uri in gobblin-mapreduce.properties and GOBBLIN_WORK_DIR in gobblin-env.sh, instead of using hdfs://localhost:8020.
All problems resolved and everything now works. I've updated the pull request.
Please add the DataNucleus license in NOTICE file.

@liyinan926

Now there are a lot of comments on setting variables/command line arguments. To summarize the requirements I can think of an outline like this:

I think that gobblin-env.sh should contain global variables (used by both standalone/mr mode) . For the time being leave this empty.
Then:
**gobblin-standalone.sh:**

```
...
. $FWDIR/conf/gobblin-env.sh
CONFIG_FILE=$FWDIR/conf/gobblin-standalone.properties
...
```

**gobblin-standalone.properties:**

```
fs.uri=file:///
writer.fs.uri=${fs.uri}
...
gobblin.base.dir=/home/user/gobblin
writer.staging.dir=${gobblin.base.dir}/task-staging
...
jobconf.dir=${gobblin.base.dir}/jobs
...
```

**gobblin-mapreduce.sh:**

```
...
. $FWDIR/conf/gobblin-env.sh
GOBBLIN_CONFIG_FILE=$FWDIR/conf/gobblin-mapreduce.properties
...
```

**gobblin-mapreduce.properties:**

```
fs.uri=${FS_URL} # command line argument
writer.fs.uri=${fs.uri}
...
gobblin.base.dir=${fs.uri}/gobblin
writer.staging.dir=${gobblin.base.dir}/task-staging
...
```

What do you think?

- Modified build script to generate tarball, instead of separate files
- Added entry to NOTICE for datanucleus.

@lbendig, I think it still makes sense for users to be able to specify the working directory instead of hard-coding it. So let's keep GOBBLIN_WORK_DIR. Also as @sahilTakiar said, we plan to add a command line option to specify the working directory. Also let's keep gobblin-env.sh but leaving it empty for now. Since this pull request is getting very long due to comments, I would suggest you close this one and submit a new one with the latest changes.

LGTM. Everything we run on should use the UTF-8 as the default encoding right, so this shouldn't really change anything.
Yes, that's a good potential place to put usage of this tool.
Yes, I looked at the Charset.defaultCharset() method. It seems it will fall back to UTF-8 for our use.
@narasimhareddyv, can you verify that the UTF-8 encoding works for the SalesforceExtractor?

I think it's the right approach to rely on OutputCommitter to do the cleanup. There's an easier way to get the MR job working directory. Do the following in MRJobLauncher:

```
GobblinOutputFormat.setOutputPath(mrJobDir);
```

Then in the OutputCommitter, you can get the path using:

```
Path mrJobDir = new Path(GobblinOutputFormat.getOutputPath(context).toUri.getPath());
```

I also think we should put the writer staging and output directories to under the MR working directory by default, and only allow users to specify the data publisher output directory. This way we have full control to all the staging/temporary data in one place, and deleting the working directory deletes everything.

Can you create a unit test class for AbstractSource? Please test getPreviousWorkUnitStatesForRetry against different combinations of ConfigurationKeys.WORK_UNIT_RETRY_POLICY_KEY and ConfigurationKeys.WORK_UNIT_RETRY_ENABLED_KEY. Please also create a unit test case for this new feature.

Apparently, NullOutputFormat doesn't have a .setOutputPath() method.

I agree with the comment on task-staging directories. Should we make the changes for moving the location of task-staging and task-output in a different pull request? It will probably require changes to AbstractJobLauncher and AvroHdfsDataWriter.

Made changes based on review comments. Added unit test for AbstractSource, which tests the getPreviousWorkUnitStatesForRetry with different configurations, and also tests the new feature "OVERWRITE_CONFIGS_IN_STATESTORE".
Overall, you should not use mocking here as you can create real instances of WorkUnitState and SourceState and set properties you want.
